title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The Brig of Don, or Balgownie, as it is sometimes called, celebrated by Lord Byron in the tenth canto of Don Juan, is about a mile from Old Aberdeen.

title: Tales and sketches.
author: Miller, Hugh
snippet: " It is called," said the mendicant, " the brig of Don ; but in my young days it was better known as the brig of Balgownie ; and if you be a Scotchman perhaps you have hd^rd of it, for there are many prophecies about it by Thomas the Rhymer." " Ah," exclaimed the surgeon, " ' Balgownie brig's black wa ! ' And so I have been admiring,  for its own sake, the far-famed scene of Byron's boyhood.

title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: 69By a timely discovery of this being the road toOld Meldrum, towards which place we had alreadyproceeded about eight miles, we were enabled byretracing onr steps and crossing a by-road to regain the road to Ellon,* which we had left at theBrig o' Balgownie.

title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: * " Brig o' Balgownie, though wight be your wa'Wi* a wife's ae son, and a mare's ae foal, down ye shall sa'."

title: Art Rambles in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland ... With ... sketches, etc
author: Reid, John T.
snippet: The saying,as recollected by me, was this, but I have never heard nor seen it since I wasnine years of age :' Brig of Balgownie, black 's your wa',Wi' a wife's ae son, and a mare's ae foal,Doon ye shall fa' !'"

title: Art Rambles in the Highlands and Islands of Scotland ... With ... sketches, etc
author: Reid, John T.
snippet: It is interesting to walk to it, andbe shown through the old cathedral of St. Machar, also to walk by the Brig ofDon or Balgownie.

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: Formerly there was an old bridge here, said to bevery like the old Brig o' Balgownie on the Don.

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: As one of the most remarkable in the neighbourhood,I selected the Brig o' Balgownie, in Old Aberdeen,and spent during the first day some two hours.

title: A Voyage round Great Britain; with short views of Aberdeen, Balmoral, ... Fécamp, Havre and Paris
author: Hargreaves, Thomas
snippet: This sum was taken from the accumulation ofthe money mortified upon a small property in 1605 bySir Alexander Hay for the repairs and maintenanceof the old Brig o' Balgownie, a fine old bridge abouthalf a mile further up the river.

author: Haight, Canniff.
